plot¶

bandcalc.lattice.plot.plot_bandstructure(ax, bandstructure, k_point_names, *plotargs, **plotkargs)¶

Plot band structure on an axis

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – matplotlib axis

  • bandstructure (numpy.ndarray) – bandstructure to plot

  • k_point_names (list[str]) – names of the k points

bandcalc.lattice.plot.plot_k_path(ax, path, *plotargs, **plotkargs)¶

Plot k path on an axis

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – matplotlib axis

  • path (numpy.ndarray) – path to plot

bandcalc.lattice.plot.plot_k_path_3d(ax, path, *plotargs, **plotkargs)¶

Plot k path on an axis

Parameters

  • ax (mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.axes3d.Axes3D) – matplotlib axis

  • path (numpy.ndarray) – path to plot

bandcalc.lattice.plot.plot_lattice(ax, lattice, *plotargs, **plotkargs)¶

Plot lattice on an axis

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes) – matplotlib axis

  • lattice (numpy.ndarray) – lattice to plot

bandcalc.lattice.plot.plot_lattice_3d(ax, lattice, *plotargs, **plotkargs)¶

Plot lattice on an axis

Parameters

  • ax (mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.axes3d.Axes3D) – matplotlib axis

  • lattice (numpy.ndarray) – lattice to plot

bandcalc.lattice.plot.set_axes_equal(ax)¶

Make axes of 3D plot have equal scale so that spheres appear as spheres, cubes as cubes, etc.. This is one possible solution to Matplotlib’s ax.set_aspect(‘equal’) and ax.axis(‘equal’) not working for 3D.

Input

ax: a matplotlib axis, e.g., as output from plt.gca().

Source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/31364297
